str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern. From ana and ginosko; to know again, i.e. to read.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular

str2: David, King of Israel. Of Hebrew origin; Dabid, the Israelite king.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be hungry, needy, desire earnestly. From the same as penes; to famish; figuratively, to crave.
